019package org.tquadrat.foundation.lang;
020
021import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
022import static java.util.Arrays.deepToString;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NULL_STRING;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.SharedFormatter.format;
026
027import java.lang.reflect.Array;
028import java.util.Arrays;
029import java.util.Collection;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.Enumeration;
032import java.util.List;
033import java.util.Map;
034import java.util.Optional;
035import java.util.function.Function;
036import java.util.function.Predicate;
037import java.util.function.Supplier;
038import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;
039
040import org.apiguardian.api.API;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
043import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.BlankArgumentException;
044import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.EmptyArgumentException;
045import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.NullArgumentException;
046import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
047import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ValidationException;

049/**
050 *  This class consists of several utility methods working on
051 *  {@link Object}
052 *  instances, similar to those on
053 *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
054 *  or
055 *  {@link java.util.Collections}. <br>
056 *  <br>The class was originally inspired by the class of the same name that
057 *  was finally introduced with the Java&nbsp;7 release; some of its methods
058 *  will delegate to
059 *  {@link java.util.Objects java.util.Objects}.
060 *  others will extend the functionality of the methods with the same
061 *  name from {@code java.util.Objects}.
062 *
063 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
064 *  @version $Id: Objects.java 1032 2022-04-10 17:27:44Z tquadrat $
065 *  @since 0.1.0
066 *
067 *  @UMLGraph.link
068 */
069@UtilityClass
070@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "UseOfObsoleteDateTimeApi", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
071@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Objects.java 1032 2022-04-10 17:27:44Z tquadrat $" )
072public final class Objects
073{
074        /*--------------*\
075    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
076        \*--------------*/
077    /**
078     *  No instance allowed for this class.
079     */
080    private Objects() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Objects.class ); }
081
082        /*---------*\
083    ====** Methods **==========================================================
084        \*---------*/
085    /**
086     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive)
087     *  to {@code fromIndex + size} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range
088     *  from {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
089     *  <p>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the following
090     *  inequalities is true:</p>
091     *  <ul>
092     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
093     *    <li>{@code size < 0}</li>
094     *    <li>{@code fromIndex + size > length}, taking into account integer
095     *    overflow</li>
096     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
097     *    inequalities</li>
098     *  </ul>
099     *  <p>Calls
100     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromIndexSize(int,int,int) java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize(int,int,int)}
101     *  internally.</p>
102     *
103     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-interval.
104     *  @param  size    The size of the sub-range.
105     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
106     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
107     *      range.
108     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
109     */
110    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
111    public static final int checkFromIndexSize( final int fromIndex, final int size, final int length ) { return java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize( fromIndex, size, length ); }
112
113    /**
114     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive)
115     *  to {@code toIndex} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range from
116     *  {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
117     *  <p>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the following
118     *  inequalities is true:</p>
119     *  <ul>
120     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
121     *    <li>{@code fromIndex > toIndex}</li>
122     *    <li>{@code toIndex > length}</li>
123     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
124     *    inequalities</li>
125     *  </ul>
126     *  <p>Calls
127     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromToIndex(int,int,int) java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex(int,int,int)}
128     *  internally.</p>
129     *
130     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-range.
131     *  @param  toIndex The upper-bound (exclusive) of the sub-range.
132     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) the range.
133     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
134     *      range.
135     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
136     */
137    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
138    public static final int checkFromToIndex( final int fromIndex, final int toIndex, final int length ) { return java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex( fromIndex, toIndex, length ); }
139
140    /**
141     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the {@code index} is within the bounds of the
142     *  range from {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
143     *  <p>The {@code index} is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the
144     *  following inequalities is true:</p>
145     *  <ul>
146     *    <li>{@code index < 0}</li>
147     *    <li>{@code index >= length}</li>
148     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
149     *    inequalities</li>
150     *  </ul>
151     *  <p>Calls
152     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkIndex(int,int) java.util.Objects.checkIndex(int,int)}
153     *  internally.</p>
154     *
155     *  @param  index   The index.
156     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
157     *  @return The {@code index} if it is within bounds of the range.
158     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The {@code index} is out-of-bounds.
159     */
160    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
161    public static final int checkIndex( final int index, final int length ) { return java.util.Objects.checkIndex( index, length ); }
162
163    /**
164     *  <p>{@summary Throws the exception provided by the given supplier if the
165     *  condition resolves to {@code false}.}</p>
166     *  <p>Basically, this method is a replacement for the code sequence
167     *  below:</p>
168     *  <pre><code>  …
169     *  if( !&lt;<i>condition</i>&gt; )
170     *  {
171     *      throw new &lt;<i>WhatEver</i>&gt;Exception( &lt;<i>WhatEverMessage</i>&gt; );
172     *  }
173     *  …</code></pre>
174     *  <p>that may be easier to read that the {@code if} statement.</p>
175     *
176     *  @param  <E> The type of the exception that is thrown in case the
177     *      condition is not met.
178     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
179     *  @param  exception   The exception to throw.
180     *  @throws E   The condition was not met.
181     */
182    @SuppressWarnings( "CheckedExceptionClass" )
183    public static final <E extends Exception> void checkState( final boolean condition, final Supplier<E> exception ) throws E
184    {
185        if( !condition ) throw requireNonNullArgument( exception, "exception" ).get();
186    }   //  checkState()
187
188    /**
189     *  <p>{@summary Returns 0 if the arguments are identical and
190     *  {@code comparator.compare(a, b)} otherwise.}</p>
191     *  <p>Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, 0 is returned.</p>
192     *  <p>Calls
193     *  {@link java.util.Objects#compare(Object,Object,Comparator) java.util.Objects#compare()}
194     *  internally, but different from that method, this implementation will
195     *  throw a
196     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
197     *  in case the {@code comparator} is {@code null}.</p>
198     *
199     *  @param  <T> The type of the objects being compared.
200     *  @param  a   An object.
201     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a}.
202     *  @param  comparator  The
203     *      {@link Comparator}
204     *      to compare the first two arguments.
205     *  @return 0 if the arguments are identical and +1, 0, or -1, based on the
206     *      return value of {@code c.compare(a, b)} otherwise.
207     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code comparator} is {@code null}.
208     *
209     *  @see Comparable
210     *  @see Comparator
211     */
212    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
213    public static final <T> int compare( final T a, final T b, final Comparator<? super T> comparator ) throws NullArgumentException
214    {
215        final var retValue = a == b ? 0 : signum( java.util.Objects.compare( a, b, requireNonNullArgument( comparator, "comparator" ) ) );
216
217        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
218        return retValue;
219    }   //  compare()
220
221    /**
222     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to
223     *  each other and {@code false} otherwise.}</p>
224     *  <p>Two {@code null} values are deeply equal. If both arguments are
225     *  arrays, the algorithm in
226     *  {@link Arrays#deepEquals(Object[], Object[]) Arrays.deepEquals()}
227     *  is used to determine equality. Otherwise, equality is determined by
228     *  using the
229     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
230     *  method of the first argument.</p>
231     *  <p>Calls
232     *  {@link java.util.Objects#deepEquals(Object,Object) java.util.Objects#deepEquals()}
233     *  internally.</p>
234     *
235     *  @param  a   An object.
236     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a} for deep equality.
237     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to each other
238     *      and {@code false} otherwise.
239     *
240     *  @see    Arrays#deepEquals(Object[],Object[])
241     *  @see    Objects#equals(Object,Object)
242     */
243    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
244    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
245    public static final boolean deepEquals( final Object a, final Object b ) { return java.util.Objects.deepEquals( a, b ); }
246
247    /**
248     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each
249     *  other and {@code false} otherwise.}</p>
250     *  <p> Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, {@code true} is
251     *  returned and if exactly one argument is {@code null}, {@code false} is
252     *  returned.  Otherwise, equality is determined by using the
253     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
254     *  method of the first argument.</p>
255     *  <p>Calls
256     *  {@link java.util.Objects#equals(Object, Object)}
257     *  internally.</p>
258     *
259     *  @param  a   An object.
260     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a} for equality.
261     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each other and
262     *      {@code false} otherwise.
263     *
264     *  @see    Object#equals(Object)
265     */
266    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
267    public static final boolean equals( final Object a, final Object b ) { return java.util.Objects.equals( a, b ); }
268
269    /**
270     *  <p>{@summary Generates a hash code for a sequence of input values.} The
271     *  hash code is generated as if all the input values were placed into an
272     *  array, and that array is hashed by calling
273     *  {@link Arrays#hashCode(Object[])}.</p>
274     *  <p>Calls
275     *  {@link java.util.Arrays#hashCode(Object[]) java.util.Arrays.hashCode()}
276     *  internally.</p>
277     *
278     *  @param  values  The values to be hashed.
279     *  @return A hash value of the sequence of input values.
280     *
281     *  @see    List#hashCode
282     */
283    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
284    public static final int hash( final Object... values ) { return Arrays.hashCode( values ); }
285
286    /**
287     *  <p>{@summary Returns the hash code of a non-{@code null} argument and 0
288     *  for a {@code null} argument.}</p>
289     *  <p>Calls
290     *  {@link java.util.Objects#hashCode(Object) java.util.Objects.hashCode(Object)}
291     *  internally.</p>
292     *
293     *  @param o   An object.
294     *  @return The hash code of an argument that is not {@code null}, and 0
295     *      for a {@code null} argument,
296     *
297     *  @see    Object#hashCode
298     */
299    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
300    public static final int hashCode( final Object o ) { return java.util.Objects.hashCode( o ); }
301
302    /**
303     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is
304     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
305     *  <p>This method can be used as a
306     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
307     *  {@code filter(Objects::isNull)}.</p>
308     *  <p>Calls
309     *  {@link java.util.Objects#isNull(Object) java.util.Objects.isNull()}
310     *  internally.</p>
311     *
312     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}.
313     *  @return {@code true} if the provided reference is {@code null},
314     *      otherwise {@code false}
315     *
316     *  @see    java.util.function.Predicate
317     *  @see    org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#IS_NULL
318     */
319    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
320    public static final boolean isNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.isNull( obj ); }
321
322    /**
323     *  <p>{@summary Maps (converts) the given object instance by applying the
324     *  provided mapper if the instance is not {@code null}.}</p>
325     *  <p>The mapper function will not be called at all if the given instance is
326     *  {@code null}.</p>
327     *
328     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
329     *  @param  <R> The type of the result.
330     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
331     *  @param  mapper  The mapping function.
332     *  @return The result of the mapping, or {@code null} if the given object
333     *      instance was already {@code null}.
334     */
335    public static final <T,R> R mapNonNull( final T o, final Function<T,R> mapper )
336    {
337        @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantExplicitVariableType" )
338        final R retValue = nonNull( o ) ? requireNonNullArgument( mapper, "mapper" ).apply( o ) : null;
339
340        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
341        return retValue;
342    }   //  mapNonNull()
343
344    /**
345     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is not
346     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
347     *  <p>This method exists to be used as a
348     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
349     *  {@code filter(Objects::nonNull)}</p>
350     *  <p>Calls
351     *  {@link java.util.Objects#nonNull(Object) java.util.Objects.nonNull()}
352     *  internally.</p>
353     *
354     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}
355     *  @return {@code false} if the provided reference is {@code null},
356     *      otherwise {@code true}
357     *
358     *  @see java.util.function.Predicate
359     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NON_NULL
360     */
361    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
362    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
363    public static final boolean nonNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.nonNull( obj ); }
364
365    /**
366     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
367     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
368     *  is thrown.
369     *
370     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
371     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
372     *  @param  validation  The validation
373     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
374     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    {@code a} failed the validation.
375     *
376     *  @since 0.1.0
377     */
378    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
379    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
380    public static final <T> T require( final T a, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws IllegalArgumentException
381    {
382        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
383        {
384            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
385        }
386
387        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
388        return a;
389    }   //  require()
390
391    /**
392     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
393     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
394     *  with the specified message is thrown.
395     *
396     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
397     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
398     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
399     *  @param  validation  The validation
400     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
401     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    {@code a} failed the validation.
402     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
403     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
404     *
405     *  @since 0.1.0
406     */
407    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
408    public static final <T> T require( final T a, final String message, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws IllegalArgumentException, NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
409    {
410        requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" );
411
412        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
413        {
414            throw new IllegalArgumentException( message );
415        }
416
417        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
418        return a;
419    }   //  require()
420
421    /**
422     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
423     *  that fails, a customized
424     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
425     *  is thrown.}</p>
426     *  <p>Unlike the method
427     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
428     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
429     *  validation was performed (and failed). While this may confer a
430     *  performance advantage in the success case, some care  should be taken
431     *  that the costs the creation of the message supplier are less than the
432     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
433     *
434     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
435     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
436     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
437     *      in the event that an {@code IllegalArgumentException} is thrown. If
438     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
439     *      provided to the exception.
440     *  @param  validation  The validation
441     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
442     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    {@code a} failed the validation.
443     *
444     *  @since 0.1.0
445     */
446    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
447    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
448    public static final <T> T require( final T a, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws IllegalArgumentException
449    {
450        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
451        {
452            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
453                ? new IllegalArgumentException( messageSupplier.get() )
454                : new IllegalArgumentException();
455            throw exception;
456        }
457
458        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
459        return a;
460    }   //  require()
461
462    /**
463     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
464     *  that fails, a customized
465     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
466     *  is thrown.}</p>
467     *  <p>Unlike the method
468     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
469     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
470     *  validation was performed (and failed). While this may confer a
471     *  performance advantage in the success case, some care  should be taken
472     *  that the costs the creation of the message supplier are less than the
473     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
474     *  <p>This implementation is different from
475     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object, Supplier)}
476     *  as it takes an instance of
477     *  {@link Function}
478     *  for the {@code messageSupplier}. That function is called with {@code a}
479     *  as the argument; this allows to add the invalid value to the exception
480     *  detail message. The provided message supplier function must accept
481     *  {@code null} as a valid argument.</p>
482     *
483     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
484     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
485     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
486     *      in the event that an {@code IllegalArgumentException} is thrown. If
487     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
488     *      provided.
489     *  @param  validation  The validation
490     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
491     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    {@code a} failed the validation.
492     *
493     *  @since 0.1.0
494     */
495    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
496    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
497    public static final <T> T require( final T a, final Function<? super T,String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws IllegalArgumentException
498    {
499        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
500        {
501            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
502                ? new IllegalArgumentException( messageSupplier.apply( a ) )
503                : new IllegalArgumentException();
504            throw exception;
505        }
506
507        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
508        return a;
509    }   //  require()
510
511    /**
512     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given value {@code a} is {@code null} and
513     *  throws a
514     *  {@link NullPointerException}
515     *  if it is {@code null}.}</p>
516     *  <p>Calls
517     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object) java.util.Objects.requireNonNull(Object)}
518     *  internally.</p>
519     *
520     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
521     *  @param  a   The value to check.
522     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
523     *  @throws NullPointerException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
524     */
525    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
526    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T a ) { return java.util.Objects.requireNonNull( a ); }
527
528    /**
529     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given value {@code a} is {@code null} and
530     *  throws a
531     *  {@link NullPointerException}
532     *  with the specified message if it is {@code null}.}</p>
533     *  <p>Calls
534     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object,String) java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object,String)}
535     *  internally, but requires that the given {@code message} is not
536     *  {@code null} or empty.</p>
537     *
538     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
539     *  @param  a   The value to check.
540     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
541     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
542     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code a} is {@code null}.
543     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
544     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
545     */
546    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
547    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T a, final String message ) throws NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
548    {
549        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNull( a, requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" ) );
550    }   //  requireNonNull()
551
552    /**
553     *  <p>{@summary Checks that the specified object reference is not
554     *  {@code null} and throws a customized
555     *  {@link NullPointerException}
556     *  if it is.}</p>
557     *  <p>Unlike the method
558     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object, String)},
559     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
560     *  null check failed. While this may confer a performance advantage in the
561     *  non-{@code null} case, when deciding to call this method care should be
562     *  taken that the costs of creating the message supplier are less than the
563     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
564     *  <p>Calls
565     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object, Supplier)}
566     *  internally.</p>
567     *
568     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
569     *  @param  a   The value to check.
570     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
571     *      in the event that a {@code NullPointerException} is thrown. If
572     *      {@code null}, no detail message is provided.
573     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
574     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code A} is {@code null}
575     */
576    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
577    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T a, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier) { return java.util.Objects.requireNonNull( a, messageSupplier ); }
578
579    /**
580     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} and throws a
581     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
582     *  if it is {@code null}.
583     *
584     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
585     *  @param  a   The argument to check.
586     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
587     *      message.
588     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}.
589     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
590     */
591    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
592    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T a, final String name )
593    {
594        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
595        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
596        if( isNull( a ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
597
598        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
599        return a;
600    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
601
602    /**
603     *  <p>{@summary Checks if not both of the given arguments {@code a} and
604     *  {@code other} are {@code null} and throws a
605     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
606     *  if both are {@code null}.} Otherwise, it returns {@code a}.</p>
607     *
608     *  @param  <T> The type of the first argument to check.
609     *  @param  arg The first argument to check; it will be returned in case of
610     *      success, even if {@code null}.
611     *  @param  otherArg    The other argument to check.
612     *  @param  name    The name of the first argument; this is used for the
613     *      error message.
614     *  @param  otherName   The name of the other argument; this is used for
615     *      the error message.
616     *  @return The first argument, even that might be {@code null}.
617     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Both arguments are {@code null}.
618     */
619    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.7" )
620    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T arg, final Object otherArg, final String name, final String otherName )
621    {
622        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
623        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
624        if( isNull( otherName ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "otherName" );
625        if( otherName.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "otherName" );
626        if( isNull( arg ) && isNull( otherArg ) )
627        {
628            throw new NullArgumentException( name, otherName );
629        }
630
631        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
632        return arg;
633    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
634
635    /**
636     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given String argument {@code a} is
637     *  {@code null}, empty or blank and throws a
638     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
639     *  if it is {@code null}, an
640     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
641     *  if it is empty, or a
642     *  {@link BlankArgumentException}
643     *  if it is blank.}</p>
644     *
645     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
646     *  @param  a   The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
647     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
648     *      message.
649     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}, empty or blank.
650     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
651     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code a} is empty.
652     *  @throws BlankArgumentException   {@code a} is blank.
653     *
654     *  @see    String#isBlank()
655     */
656    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
657    public static final <T extends CharSequence> T requireNotBlankArgument( final T a, final String name )
658    {
659        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
660        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
661
662        switch( a )
663        {
664            case null -> throw new NullArgumentException( name );
665            //noinspection QuestionableName
666            case String string ->
667            {
668                if( string.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
669                if( string.isBlank() ) throw new BlankArgumentException( name );
670            }
671            case CharSequence charSequence ->
672            {
673                if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
674                if( charSequence.toString().isBlank() ) throw new BlankArgumentException( name );
675            }
676        }
677
678        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
679        return a;
680    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
681
682    /**
683     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} or
684     *  empty and throws a
685     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
686     *  if it is {@code null}, or an
687     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
688     *  if it is empty.}</p>
689     *  <p>Strings, arrays, instances of
690     *  {@link java.util.Collection} and
691     *  {@link java.util.Map}
692     *  as well as instances of
693     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuilder},
694     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuffer},
695     *  and
696     *  {@link java.lang.CharSequence}
697     *  will be checked on being empty.</p>
698     *  <p>For an instance of
699     *  {@link java.util.Optional},
700     *  the presence of a value is checked in order to determine whether the
701     *  {@link Optional} is empty or not.</p>
702     *  <p>Because the interface
703     *  {@link java.util.Enumeration}
704     *  does not provide an API for the check on emptiness
705     *  ({@link java.util.Enumeration#hasMoreElements() hasMoreElements()}
706     *  will return {@code false} after all elements have been taken from
707     *  the {@code Enumeration} instance), the result for arguments of this
708     *  type has to be taken with caution.</p>
709     *  <p>For instances of
710     *  {@link java.util.stream.Stream},
711     *  this method will only check for {@code null} (like
712     *  {@link #requireNonNullArgument(Object,String)}.
713     *  This is because any operation on the stream itself would render it
714     *  unusable for later processing.</p>
715     *  <p>In case the argument is of type
716     *  {@link Optional},
717     *  this method behaves different from
718     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String)};
719     *  this one will return the {@code Optional} instance, while the other
720     *  method will return the contents of the {@code Optional}.</p>
721     *  <p>This method will not work properly for instances of
722     *  {@link java.util.StringJoiner}, because its method
723     *  {@link java.util.StringJoiner#length() length()}
724     *  will not return 0 when a prefix, suffix, or an
725     *  &quot;{@linkplain java.util.StringJoiner#setEmptyValue(CharSequence) empty value}&quot;
726     *  was provided.</p>
727     *
728     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
729     *  @param  a   The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
730     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
731     *      message.
732     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null} or empty.
733     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
734     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code a} is empty.
735     */
736    @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyComplexMethod" )
737    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
738    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( final T a, final String name )
739    {
740        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
741        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
742
743        switch( a )
744        {
745            /*
746             * When using guarding expressions, the code would not get better
747             * to read and to understand, as the positive cases will be handled
748             * all by the default case.
749             */
750            case null -> throw new NullArgumentException( name );
751            case CharSequence charSequence ->
752            {
753                if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
754            }
755            case Collection<?> collection ->
756            {
757                if( collection.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
758            }
759            case Map<?,?> map ->
760            {
761                if( map.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
762            }
763            case Enumeration<?> enumeration ->
764            {
765                /*
766                 * The funny thing with an Enumeration is that it could have been
767                 * not empty in the beginning, but it may be empty (= having no
768                 * more elements) now.
769                 * The good thing is that Enumeration.hasMoreElements() will not
770                 * change the state of the Enumeration - at least it should not do
771                 * so.
772                 */
773                if( !enumeration.hasMoreElements() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
774            }
775            case Optional<?> optional ->
776            {
777                /*
778                 * This is different from the behaviour of
779                 * requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String) as the Optional
780                 * will be returned here.
781                 */
782                if( optional.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
783            }
784            default ->
785            {
786                if( a.getClass().isArray() )
787                {
788                    if( Array.getLength( a ) == 0 ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
789                }
790                else
791                {
792                    /*
793                     * Other data types are not further processed; in
794                     * particular, instances of Stream cannot be checked on
795                     * being empty. This is because any operation on the Stream
796                     * itself will change its state and may make the Stream
797                     * unusable.
798                     */
799                }
800            }
801        }
802
803        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
804        return a;
805    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
806
807    /**
808     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given argument {@code a} of type
809     *  {@link Optional}
810     *  is {@code null} or
811     *  {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}
812     *  and throws a
813     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
814     *  if it is {@code null}, or a
815     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
816     *  if it is empty.}</p>
817     *  <p>Otherwise it returns the value of the {@code Optional}.</p>
818     *  <p>This is different from the behaviour of
819     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Object,String)}
820     *  with an instance of {@code Optional} as the argument to test.</p>
821     *
822     *  @param  <T> The type of the given {@code Optional} to check.
823     *  @param  optional    The argument to check; can be {@code null}.
824     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
825     *      message.
826     *  @return The value of the argument if {@code optional} is not
827     *      {@code null}
828     *      and not
829     *      {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}. This could be the empty
830     *      string!
831     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code optional} is {@code null}.
832     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code optional} is empty.
833     */
834    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
835    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" ) final Optional<T> optional, final String name )
836    {
837        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
838        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
839
840        //---* Check for null *------------------------------------------------
841        if( isNull( optional ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
842        final var retValue = optional.orElseThrow( () -> new EmptyArgumentException( name ) );
843
844        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
845        return retValue;
846    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
847
848    /**
849     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null},
850     *  otherwise it returns the non-{@code null} second argument.}</p>
851     *  <p>This implementation behaves different from that in
852     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object,Object) java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse(Object,Object)}
853     *  as it will always check that the default is not {@code null}.</p>
854     *
855     *  @param <T>  The type of the references.
856     *  @param  obj An object reference.
857     *  @param  defaultObj  Another object reference to be returned if the
858     *      first argument is {@code null}.
859     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
860     *      second argument if it is not {@code null}.
861     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code defaultObj} is {@code null}.
862     *
863     *  @see    java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object, Object)
864     */
865    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
866    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElse( final T obj, final T defaultObj ) throws NullArgumentException
867    {
868        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse( obj, requireNonNullArgument( defaultObj, "defaultObj" ) );
869    }   //  requireNonNullElse()
870
871    /**
872     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null},
873     *  otherwise it returns the non-{@code null} value returned by
874     *  {@link Supplier#get() supplier.get()}.}</p>
875     *  <p>This implementation behaves different from that in
876     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier) java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier)}
877     *  as it will always check that the supplier is not {@code null}.</p>
878     *
879     *  @note   Although the provided {@code Supplier} may not be {@code null},
880     *      it may <i>return</i> {@code null}.
881     *
882     *  @param <T>  The type of the reference.
883     *  @param  obj An object reference.
884     *  @param  supplier    The supplier of a non-{@code null} object of type
885     *      {code T} to return if the first argument is {@code null}.
886     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
887     *      value returned by a call to {@code supplier.get()} if it is not
888     *      {@code null}.
889     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code supplier} is {@code null}.
890     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code obj} is {@code null} and the
891     *      return value of {@code supplier.get()} value is {@code null}, too.
892     */
893    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionDeclared" )
894    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
895    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElseGet( final T obj, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier ) throws NullArgumentException, NullPointerException
896    {
897        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet( obj, requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ) );
898    }   //  requireNonNullElseGet()
899
900    /**
901     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
902     *  {@link ValidationException}
903     *  with a default message is thrown.
904     *
905     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
906     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
907     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
908     *      message.
909     *  @param  validation  The validation
910     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
911     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
912     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} or {@code validation} is
913     *      {@code null}.
914     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
915     *
916     *  @since 0.1.0
917     */
918    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
919    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T a, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
920    {
921        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
922
923        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
924        {
925            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
926        }
927
928        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
929        return a;
930    }   //  requireValidArgument()
931
932    /**
933     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
934     *  that fails, a
935     *  {@link ValidationException}
936     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
937     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
938     *  argument.</p>
939     *
940     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
941     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
942     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
943     *      message.
944     *  @param  validation  The validation
945     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
946     *      exception.
947     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
948     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
949     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name}, {@code validation} or
950     *      {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
951     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
952     *
953     *  @since 0.1.0
954     */
955    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
956    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T a, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
957    {
958        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
959        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
960
961        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
962        {
963            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
964        }
965
966        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
967        return a;
968    }   //  requireValidArgument()
969
970    /**
971     *  Applies the given validation on the given value (that must not be
972     *  {@code null}), and if that fails, an
973     *  {@link ValidationException}
974     *  with a default message is thrown.
975     *
976     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
977     *  @param  a   The value to check.
978     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
979     *      message.
980     *  @param  validation  The validation
981     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
982     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
983     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a}, {@code name} or
984     *      {@code validation} is {@code null}.
985     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
986     *
987     *  @since 0.1.0
988     */
989    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
990    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T a, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
991    {
992        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
993
994        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( a, "name" ) ) )
995        {
996            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
997        }
998
999        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1000        return a;
1001    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
1002
1003    /**
1004     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value (that must
1005     *  not be {@code null}), and if that fails, a
1006     *  {@link ValidationException}
1007     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1008     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1009     *  argument.</p>
1010     *
1011     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1012     *  @param  a   The value to check.
1013     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1014     *      message.
1015     *  @param  validation  The validation
1016     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
1017     *      exception.
1018     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1019     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
1020     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a}, {@code name},
1021     *      {@code validation} or {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1022     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1023     *
1024     *  @since 0.1.0
1025     */
1026    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1027    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T a, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
1028    {
1029        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1030        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
1031
1032        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( a, "name" ) ) )
1033        {
1034            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
1035        }
1036
1037        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1038        return a;
1039    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
1040
1041    /**
1042     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1043     *  {@link String},
1044     *  usually by calling its
1045     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1046     *  method.} If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1047     *  &quot;{@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING null}&quot;
1048     *  will be returned instead. Arrays will be converted to a String through
1049     *  calling the respective {@code toString()} method from
1050     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1051     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1052     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object, String) java.util.Objects.toString()}).
1053     *  Values of type
1054     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1055     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1056     *  will be translated based on the default locale - whatever that is.
1057     *
1058     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1059     *  @return The object's string representation.
1060     *
1061     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1062     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1063     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1064     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1065     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1066     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1067     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1068     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1069     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1070     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1071     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1072     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING
1073     */
1074    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1075    public static final String toString( final Object object )
1076    {
1077        return toString( object, NULL_STRING );
1078    }   //  toString()
1079
1080    /**
1081     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1082     *  {@link String},
1083     *  usually by calling its
1084     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1085     *  method.} If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1086     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned
1087     *  instead.</p>
1088     *  <p>Arrays will be converted to a string through calling the respective
1089     *  {@code toString()} method from
1090     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1091     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1092     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object,String) java.util.Objects.toString(Object,String)}).</p>
1093     *  <p>Values of type
1094     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1095     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1096     *  will be translated based on the
1097     *  {@link java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}
1098     *  – whatever that is.</p>
1099     *
1100     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1101     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1102     *      is {@code null}.
1103     *  @return The object's string representation.
1104     *
1105     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1106     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1107     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1108     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1109     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1110     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1111     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1112     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1113     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1114     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1115     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1116     */
1117    @SuppressWarnings( {"IfStatementWithTooManyBranches", "ChainOfInstanceofChecks", "OverlyComplexMethod"} )
1118    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1119    public static final String toString( final Object object, final String nullDefault )
1120    {
1121        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1122        if( nonNull( object ) )
1123        {
1124            final var objectClass = object.getClass();
1125            if( objectClass.isArray() )
1126            {
1127                if( objectClass == byte [].class )
1128                {
1129                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (byte []) object );
1130                }
1131                else if( objectClass == short [].class )
1132                {
1133                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (short []) object );
1134                }
1135                else if( objectClass == int [].class )
1136                {
1137                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (int []) object );
1138                }
1139                else if( objectClass == long [].class )
1140                {
1141                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (long []) object );
1142                }
1143                else if( objectClass == char [].class )
1144                {
1145                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (char []) object );
1146                }
1147                else if( objectClass == float [].class )
1148                {
1149                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (float []) object );
1150                }
1151                else if( objectClass == double [].class )
1152                {
1153                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (double []) object );
1154                }
1155                else if( objectClass == boolean [].class )
1156                {
1157                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (boolean []) object );
1158                }
1159                else
1160                {
1161                    retValue = deepToString( (Object []) object );
1162                }
1163            }
1164            else
1165            {
1166                retValue = object.toString();
1167            }
1168        }
1169
1170        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1171        return retValue;
1172    }   //  toString()
1173
1174    /**
1175     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1176     *  {@link String}
1177     *  using the given instance of
1178     *  {@link Stringer}.}
1179     *  If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1180     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned
1181     *  instead.</p>
1182     *
1183     *  @param  <T> The type of the object.
1184     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1185     *  @param  stringer    The method that is used to convert the given object
1186     *      to a String.
1187     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1188     *      is {@code null}.
1189     *  @return The object's string representation.
1190     *
1191     *  @see    Stringer
1192     */
1193    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1194    public static final <T> String toString( final T object, final Stringer<? super T> stringer, final String nullDefault )
1195    {
1196        requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1197
1198        final var retValue = nonNull( object ) ? requireNonNullArgument( stringer, "stringer" ).toString( object ) : nullDefault;
1199
1200        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1201        return retValue;
1202    }   //  toString()
1203}
1204//  class Objects

1207 *  End of File
